extracted-table.table-caption: Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI) scores of the participants.

caption.p: Interpersonal Reactivity Index (IRI) scores of the participants.

table-wrap-foot.p: All participants were female. In the IRI session, we included Nurses (n = 42; Age: 30.9 ± 8.4 years) and Controls (n = 42; Age: 29.4 ± 9.6 years). The IRI contains four subscales: Perspective taking, Empathic concern, Fantasy, and Personal distress. There was a significant difference between Nurses and Controls only in the Fantasy subscale score (p = 0.028*). Data are expressed as means ± standard deviation (SD). *p < 0.05 using two-sample t-test. n = number of subjects.

The IRI contains four subscales: Perspective taking, Empathic concern, Fantasy, and Personal distress. There was a significant difference between Nurses and Controls only in the Fantasy subscale score (p = 0.028*). Data are expressed as means ± standard deviation (SD). *p < 0.05 using two-sample t-test. n = number of subjects.

extracted-table.table-caption: Comparative demographics of the participants in the MRI session.

caption.p: Comparative demographics of the participants in the MRI session.

table-wrap-foot.p: Twenty nurses and 20 controls among those who participated in the IRI session underwent MRI scanning. Differences between the groups were assessed by t-test. We confirmed that there was no difference between sessions (IRI and MRI sessions) in age, Fantasy subscale score, and education duration in both groups. MRI, magnetic resonance imaging; IRI, Interpersonal Reactivity Index; n, number of subjects; MCS, Mental component summary; PCS, Physical component summary.

extracted-table.table-caption: Significant difference in gray matter volume (GMV) between the groups (Control > Nurse).

caption.p: Significant difference in gray matter volume (GMV) between the groups (Control > Nurse).

table-wrap-foot.p: Coordinates refer to local cluster maxima. FDR corrected p < 0.05 at the cluster level with uncorrected p < 0.005 at the voxel level were employed. FDR, false discovery rate.

extracted-table.table-caption: Multiple regression analysis using the average beta value in the striatum cluster as the dependent variable in the MRI session.

caption.p: Multiple regression analysis using the average beta value in the striatum cluster as the dependent variable in the MRI session.

table-wrap-foot.p: In multiple regression analysis, only the Fantasy subscale score showed a significant positive association with the average beta value in the striatum cluster (β = 0.0042, p = 0.0459). *p value less than 0.05 was considered statistically significant. MRI, magnetic resonance imaging; MCS, Mental component summary; PCS, Physical component summary; CI, confidence interval.

extracted-table.table-caption: Significant brain regions seeding the right striatum between the groups (Control > Nurse) in the resting state fMRI analysis.

caption.p: Significant brain regions seeding the right striatum between the groups (Control > Nurse) in the resting state fMRI analysis.

table-wrap-foot.p: Coordinates refer to local cluster maxima. The statistical threshold for significant differences was set at FDR corrected p < 0.05 at the cluster level with uncorrected p < 0.005 at the voxel level. FDR, false discovery rate; resting state fMRI, resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging; PFC, prefrontal cortex.
